Module zti.utils
Package by.zti.main.scanner

Class ConsoleScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • by.zti.main.scanner.ConsoleScanner

  • public class ConsoleScanner
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a utility class that allows it's instances to read input stream of system console and execute particular code associated with different commands depending on the input of the stream. In order to properly use this class you should create an instance of it and populate it with different commands.
    Since:
    ZTIU 1.0.1
    See Also:
    Command, Consumable

      ConsoleScanner​(java.lang.String commandPrefix, java.lang.String paramPrefix)

      ConsoleScanner​(java.lang.String commandPrefix, java.lang.String paramPrefix, boolean sync)
      Allocates new ConsoleScanner object that contains all data necessary to popper reading of system input.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConsoleScanner

        public ConsoleScanner​(java.lang.String commandPrefix,
                      java.lang.String paramPrefix)
        Allocates new ConsoleScanner object that contains all data necessary to popper reading of system input. Scanner instance created bu this constructor will work in synchronous mode.
        Parameters:
        commandPrefix - Command prefix that will be used to determine which of the scanner token is actual command name.
        paramPrefix - Parameter prefix thai will be used to determine which of the scanner token is actual parameter name.

      • ConsoleScanner

        public ConsoleScanner​(java.lang.String commandPrefix,
                      java.lang.String paramPrefix,
                      boolean sync)
        Allocates new ConsoleScanner object that contains all data necessary to popper reading of system input. Scanner instance created bu this constructor will work in asynchronous mode.
        Parameters:
        commandPrefix - Command prefix that will be used to determine which of the scanner token is actual command name.
        paramPrefix - Parameter prefix thai will be used to determine which of the scanner token is actual parameter name.
        sync - Asynchronous boolean flag

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start​()
        This method should be used to start scanner in asynchronous mode

      • scan

        public void scan​()
        This method should be used any time you want to read something from console. In synchronous mode you have to call it manually, in asynchronous mode ot will be called automatically by scanner thread.

      • scan

        public void scan​(java.io.File file)
        This method should be used if you want to load a set of sequential commands from external text file. This could be useful for initialising and populating your program from external sources.
        Parameters:
        file - File object pointing to script file.

      • stop

        public void stop​()
        This method should be called to stop scanner in asynchronous mode.

      • getCommands

        public java.util.List<Command> getCommands​()
        Returns:
        List of all commands in scanner.

        public boolean isRunning​()
        Returns:
